articles.title: OpenAI CEO declares ‚Äúcode red‚Äù as Gemini gains 200 million users in 3 months
articles.description: Three years after Google sounded alarm bells over ChatGPT, the tables have turned.
articles.content: The shoe is most certainly on the other foot. On Monday, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman reportedly declared a ‚Äúcode red‚Äù at the company to improve ChatGPT, delaying advertising plans and other products in the process, The Information reported based on a leaked internal memo. The move follows Google‚Äôs release of its Gemini 3 model last month, which has outperformed ChatGPT on some industry benchmark tests and sparked high-profile praise on social media. In the memo, Altman wrote, ‚ÄúWe are at a critical tim

articles.description: You can tell a lot about a company by what they're willing to sue over. Take Instacart, which just filed a lawsuit against New York City. Its beef? The company doesn't like five new city laws, set to take effect in January. They would require Instacart to pay workers more and give customers
articles.content: You can tell a lot about a company by what they're willing to sue over. Take Instacart, which just filed a lawsuit against New York City. Its beef? The company doesn't like five new city laws, set to take effect in January. They would require Instacart to pay workers more and give customers a tipping option of at least 10 percent. Reuters reports that Instacart's suit targets Local Law 124, which mandates that grocery delivery workers receive the same minimum pay as restaurant delive

articles.title: Optimize Like a Pro: Advanced JavaScript Memory Techniques for Large-Scale Projects
articles.description: A Deep, Extended, Example-Packed Article Managing memory properly in JavaScript is one of the most critical skills for building fast, stable, and scalable applications. Whether you're developing a complex frontend interface, a long-running SPA, a Node.js backend, or a real-time system, poor memory h
articles.content: A Deep, Extended, Example-Packed Article Managing memory properly in JavaScript is one of the most critical skills for building fast, stable, and scalable applications. Whether you're developing a complex frontend interface, a long-running SPA, a Node.js backend, or a real-time system, poor memory handling can cause slowdowns, UI freezes, increased RAM usage, or even total crashes. JavaScript has automatic memory management through its garbage collector, but automatic does NOT mean perfect . Inc
articles.author: Ahmed Niazy

articles.content: ExpressVPN, one of the best VPNs , is launching two brand-new features that sound confusingly like things it already does. Users on Android, Mac and iOS (but apparently not Windows, Linux or smart TVs) can now use Fastest Location to automatically pick the VPN server with the fastest download speed and lowest latency. Every Monday for the next two weeks, writers from both publications will debate one aspect of the generative AI revolution reshaping global power. This week, Richard Waters, FT columnist and f
articles.content: Welcome back to The State of AI, a new collaboration between the Financial Times and MIT Technology Review . Every Monday for the next two weeks, writers from both publications will debate one aspect of the generative AI revolution reshaping global power. This week, Richard Waters, FT columnist and former West Coast editor, talks with MIT Technology Review ‚Äôs editor at large David Rotman about the true impact of AI on the job market. Bonus: If you’re an MIT Technology Review subscriber, yo
articles.author: David Rotman and Richard Waters

articles.title: How to orchestrate agents using mission control
articles.description: Run multiple Copilot agents from one place. Learn prompt techniques, how to spot drift early, and how to review agent work efficiently. The post How to orchestrate agents using mission control appeared first on The GitHub Blog .
articles.content: We recently shipped Agent HQ’s mission control , a unified interface for managing GitHub Copilot coding agent tasks. Now, you can now assign tasks to Copilot across repos, pick a custom agent, watch real‑time session logs, steer mid-run (pause, refine, or restart), and jump straight into the resulting pull requests—all in one place. Instead of bouncing between pages to see status, rationale, and changes, mission control centralizes assignment, oversight, and review. Having the
articles.author: Matt Nigh

articles.title: ‚ÄúThe local-first rebellion‚Äù: How Home Assistant became the most important project in your house
articles.description: Learn how one of GitHub‚Äôs fastest-growing open source projects is redefining smart homes without the cloud. The post ‚ÄúThe local-first rebellion‚Äù: How Home Assistant became the most important project in your house appeared first on The GitHub Blog .
articles.content: Franck Nijhof—better known as Frenck—is one of those maintainers who ended up at the center of a massive open source project not because he chased the spotlight, but because he helped hold together one of the most active, culturally important, and technically demanding open source ecosystems on the planet. As a lead of Home Assistant and a GitHub Star , Frenck guides the project that didn’t just grow. It exploded. This year’s Octoverse report confirms it : Home Assistant
articles.author: Andrea Griffiths

The State of AI: Welcome to the economic singularity ‚ÄîDavid Rotman and Richard Waters Any far-reaching new technology is always uneven in its adoption, but few have been more uneven than generative AI. articles.content: Here‚Äôs a concrete, simple example of what a Fiber node ‚Äúlooks like‚Äù and how it links to others, using a tiny DOM tree. Pazdur, an oncologist who has worked at the FDA since 1999, was seen as a stabilizing force for an agency that has been mired in turmoil during the second Trump administration. articles.content: One of the iPhone‚Äôs many accessibility features is something Apple calls "Magnifier," which uses the smartphone's cameras to magnify and identify objects in the world around you. For Global Accessibility Awareness Day in May this year, Apple brought Magnifier to the Mac, opening up even more places the assistive tool can be used, like classroom or work environments where you might already have a MacBook pulled out. Magnifier requires macOS 26 Tahoe and can work with a built-in webcam, a conn
